Class CausticUtil

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object

      • checkVersion

        public static void checkVersion(GLVersioned required,
                                GLVersioned object)
        Checks if two OpenGL versioned object have compatible version. Throws an exception if that's not the case. A version is determined to be compatible with another is it's lower than the said version. This isn't always true when deprecation is involved, but it's an acceptable way of doing this in most implementations.
        Parameters:
        required - The required version
        object - The object to check the version of
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the object versions are not compatible

      • getImageData

        public static ByteBuffer getImageData(InputStream source,
                                      Texture.Format format,
                                      Rectangle size)
        Gets the InputStream's data as a ByteBuffer. The image data reading is done according to the Texture.Format. The image size is stored in the passed Rectangle instance. The returned buffer is flipped an ready for reading.
        Parameters:
        source - The image input stream to extract the data from
        format - The format of the image data
        size - The rectangle to store the size in
        Returns:
        The flipped buffer containing the decoded image data

      • getImageData

        public static ByteBuffer getImageData(BufferedImage image,
                                      Texture.Format format)
        Gets the BufferedImage's data as a ByteBuffer. The image data reading is done according to the Texture.Format. The returned buffer is flipped an ready for reading.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to extract the data from
        format - The format of the image data
        Returns:
        The flipped buffer containing the decoded image data

      • getImageData

        public static ByteBuffer getImageData(int[] pixels,
                                      Texture.Format format,
                                      int width,
                                      int height)
        Sets the texture's image data. The image data reading is done according to the given Texture.Format. The returned buffer is flipped an ready for reading.
        Parameters:
        pixels - The image pixels
        width - The width of the image
        height - the height of the image
        Returns:
        The flipped buffer containing the decoded image data

      • getPackedPixels

        public static int[] getPackedPixels(ByteBuffer imageData,
                                    Texture.Format format,
                                    Rectangle size)
        Converts a byte buffer of image data to a flat integer array integer where each pixel is and integer in the ARGB format. Input data is expected to be 8 bits per component. If the format has no alpha, 0xFF is written as the value.
        Parameters:
        imageData - The source image data
        format - The format of the image data, 8 bits per component
        size - The size of the image
        Returns:
        The packed pixel array

      • getImage

        public static BufferedImage getImage(ByteBuffer imageData,
                                     Texture.Format format,
                                     Rectangle size)
        Converts a byte buffer of image data to a buffered image in the ARGB format. Input data is expected to be 8 bits per component. If the format has no alpha, 0xFF is written as the value.
        Parameters:
        imageData - The source image data
        format - The format of the image data, 8 bits per component
        size - The size of the image
        Returns:
        The buffered image

      • fromPackedARGB

        public static com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector4f fromPackedARGB(int packed)
        Decodes a normalized float color from a packed ARGB int in the 0xAARRGGBB format.
        Parameters:
        packed - The packed color data
        Returns:
        The color as a 4 float vector

        Parameters:

        b - The blue component
        g - The green component
        a - The alpha component
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • fromHSB

        public static com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector4f fromHSB(float hue,
                                                           float saturation,
                                                           float brightness)
        Converts the components of a color, as specified by the HSB model, to an equivalent set of values for the default RGB model. The saturation and brightness components should be floating-point values between zero and one (numbers in the range [0, 1]). The hue component can be any floating-point number. Alpha will be 1.
        Parameters:
        hue - The hue component of the color
        saturation - The saturation of the color
        brightness - The brightness of the color
        Returns:
        The color as a 4 float vector

        c - The Caustic color to convert
        Returns:
